ygData.subject: A Wound I Wish You Not To See.

* Dinobot�s optics adjusted as he stared into the darkness of the forest in 
which his gaze fell, nothing moved save the delicate leaves upon the trees 
as a slight wind picked up.
The light of the silver moon above filtered into the small glade, creating 
small pools of silver light that danced about the ground as the leaves 
fluttered overhead.
Yet, all except for the rustling leaves, the continuous splashing of the 
waterfall and his own breathing, there was no sound in the entire area.
However, the suited him just fine.
Dinobot leaned back further against the small sapling at his back, it�s thin 
trunk bending slightly. If it wasn�t for the fact that they could be 
attacked at any time, he could have easily fallen asleep at his post.
But it just so happened that the numbness of his open chest wound had began 
to ware off and the pain was now beginning to return, now and again suddenly 
shifting to life and making him wince as it sparked.
THAT wasn�t a good sign. But then again, neither was the open gash in his 
chest that continued to bleed like never before. Though, not failing to hear 
the muffled sounds of the wolfin fembot as she slept.
Dinobot glanced into the shadows of the woods for one last moment before 
heaving himself to his feet, brushing himself off only to find that the 
silver armor of his chest was completely covered in a fresh wash of his own 
fluid.
He growled as his own hands dripped with mech-fluid but then quickly turned 
his head towards the stream and where Tavatron lay sleeping, his optics 
falling upon her after looking over the sparkling surface of the flowing 
brook.  It was time for them to get moving, and hope that they reached the 
Cybertronien Fire before he went into stasis lock from lack of fluids.
Dinobot took in a deep breath of the crisp night air as he turned once again 
towards the forest, watching every shadow for any movement, which might 
signal some sort of enemy attack. One last check never hurt anybot anyway.
However, he was a bit surprised to suddenly hear the waking rustle of fur as 
he turned back towards the small stream running through the glade, seeing 
Tavatron get to her feet after just stretching.
She would have been repaired by now, her beast mode taking care of that. 
Which meant that now was just as good a time as any to get moving, and maybe 
they would be at the Maximal ship by evening the coming day.
Dinobot growled, IF he didn�t slow then down with his wounds they would get 
there by then. But he was going to make sure that they did reach it at the 
appointed time, no matter how wounded he was or how badly he bled.
He shifted his gaze to the forest in, which was the direction they would 
leave, where the swamp lay that they MUST cross. The position of the moon 
above the canopy clearly translating to him that it was around the tenth 
mega-cycle, the perfect time to get the hardest part of their journey over 
with and done.
As he heard Tavatron speak he knew her words, though why anybot would be 
worried about HIM was completely from his mind. Though, he knew that if 
anything they would be concerned about Tavatron�s welfare, and that she 
reached the Maximal base safely. And he was going to make sure she did.
Dinobot looked carefully into the darkened shadows of the forest once again, 
but then quickly back towards the brook where Tavatron stood.*

� Agreed.�

* His voice a growl, though, only due to the sudden wave of mech-fluid that 
flowed freely from his open chest wound, seeming to replace the coat that 
had began to dry. A simply wave of pain flowing along with it.
However, he wasn�t concerned, he had been in worse condition then this 
before and lived.
Dinobot turned from Tavatron with a snarl as he heard the leaves above 
rustle, the wind picking up slightly and causing the glade floor to dance 
with what moon light the canopy was letting through.
Though, it also brought a new wash of fresh air to the wounded warrior�s 
metallic lungs, taking it in and breathing deeply.
Letting out the breath, Dinobot turned once again towards Tavatron, though 
his face set with the same aggressive stature he always wore when there was 
a task ahead.
However, inside he hoped that she wouldn�t see just how badly his wound was 
bleeding and the canopy shadows would hide it, no need for concern when 
there was an important duty at hand.*

� Ready?�
